title_sort: louisa van velsor whitman to walt whitman, 12 january [1869]
title: Louisa Van Velsor Whitman to Walt Whitman, 12 January [1869]
text: 187312th of January My dear waltWaltit seems like an age till i got your letter to day i was glad to hear you was all safe i have had a letter from heydeHeyde saying hannaHannah is much better that she sleeps better and come out in the room to her meals i have got a box of things for her shall send them on thursdayThursday i got 10 1/2 yds of muslin and two dresses one a gingamgingham and one delain and a can of peaches and some other things and georgeGeorge will give me 2 dollar to put in) i put a note on the bundle a christmasChristmas present from walterWalter to hannaHannah so i hope she will get them all safe) i also got a letter from mattyMatty yesterday saying she is better that her coughfcough is much better and she raises scarcely any they have a large parlor and their meals brought in and dishes took out at 200 doldollars per month) georgeGeorge went but only stayed a few days they was repairing the works i told him when he went i was going to rest all the time but i was taken with such a lame back and side i was in a bad state for a few days but i have got better now) the house is a dooingdoing this fine weather past has been good to work georgeyGeorgey seems very much pleasd with it) this is a short letteletter walterWalter dear i wish you could get a better room These peecespieces of a letter came here last week directed to you we could not make them out it came from new yorkNew York Louisa Van Velsor Whitman to Walt Whitman, 12 January [1869]
